In the CBS poll, 40 percent of uncommitted voters said Obama won. Twenty-six percent said John McCain won, while 34 percent said it was a tie. 
 
 Over at CNN, Obama fared even better in the poll: 54 percent said he did a better job, 30 percent gave it to McCain. 
 
 Despite those numbers, this isn't all bad news for McCain. The CBS poll did have a silver lining -- respondents still see McCain as more prepared for the job (83 percent to 58 percent).

 In case you haven't noticed, this forum is to say what we think, not what they think. I couldn't care less who "won". The question is "Did we win?" And no matter who you say "won", the answer is no. The next question is, did the debate change anyone's veiws? The answer is no, once again.

 With the way that the McCain campaign is bleeding, they needed to deliver a knock out blow. Most of the viewers among the undecided thought Obama won the debate. Mc Cain continues to lose ground as people get to know him and his proposal better. 
 
 He is desperate. He is resorting to all the tactics he said he despised and would not use ('the so called 'swift boat' tactics). 
 
 The lead that Obama has is increasing as people start seeing the differences in the economic ideas of McCain and Obama.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Post-debate polling
